job_title: Prefer Not to Answer in Sarasota, FL
pros: The residents are amazing to work with.
cons: The families are not amazing to work with, and sometimes neither are your coworkers. The third floor is chaos all the time. Not a lot of teamwork going on there. Stay away. Management will constantly question you on your intentions of taking great care of the residence.

pros: A great place to work where you really feel like you have a voice. Management listens and is willing to try new things.

cons: The families of residents are often times abusive to staff and management just allows it.

job_title: Head Of Human Resources in Sarasota, FL
pros: It was a joy to work her and serve the residents. The care is absolutely incredible, with a foundation of compassion. The staff are top notch and management works hard to provide a competitive compensation and rewards package. The culture is amazing and high performers are recognized. Under Jay's leadership and with the support of the board and senior leadership team, this community has accomplished tremendous things!
cons: Non-profit work is challenging from a financial perspective, and there were times that we had to defer campus enhancements in order to meet higher priorities.

pros:
Aviva has been an incredible experience for me on both a personal and professional level. The team here is like a big family and departments that are close tend to protect one another and provide unconditional support. 

As a senior living facility a great deal of the experience is determined by the residents who we work on behalf of. For the most part, these residents are amazing! The great ones are kind, engaged, funny, and I genuinely think of a select few of them as my own grandparents. 

Both a pro and a con is the fact that no two days are the same. When the campus is thriving and active it can be an incredible day which means laughing a lot and watching the time fly by.
cons:
I think the biggest challenge Aviva faces is the fact that it is simply an old community.  As an employee, we share most of our space with the residents which makes it difficult to have lunch with colleagues or even go to the bathroom. It would be great to have more dedicated employee spaces. 

The other big issue is salary. While there have been some huge improvements with new management taking over the salaries for positions are still lower than some of the newer communities in the area. My own salary has improved but I know it is still a problem in other departments.

pros:
Faith-based community with a strong and sincere focus on Resident and Employee satisfaction.   Management operates with integrity and addresses problems.   

Huge focus on customer service, both internal and external.  CEO and senior leadership truly care, despite what other reviews may say.  Good staff recognition programs,  nice working environment,  beautiful grounds.  

Management demonstrates consistent communication of goals and initiatives through townhall meetings, emails, timeclock postings and encourages employee feedback.   

Really good benefit program including PTO for part-time staff and generous retirement match.   Increased technology is helping staff feel connected to own data and processes, like the ADP mobile app and OnShift scheduling software.    

AHCA surveys over the last 2 years have been phenomenal.  Residents are receiving very good care.
cons:
As a stand-alone community, everyone (including management) wears several "hats" which can create variety in the day but can sometimes keep you from accomplishing daily goals or can create long days.   

We are an older community and may not show as well as  newer properties but recent and future renovations are helping the community stay relevant.  

Residents and families  have very high expectations, sometimes exceeding our ability to meet them consistently.  

Like many other communities, we are dealing with a huge challenge of staff turnover, particularly in the nursing assistant area.  Increased wages and benefits, generous referral bonus and a strong focus on recruiting staff that match our core values has  helped.  

Employees that are resistant to positive changes can give a poor and unfair impression to new staff.

job_title: Front Desk Agent in Sarasota, FL
pros: It’s like a family, my friends work here, I have leadership that supports me and trusts me to do what needs to get done without any micro managing. Also,  great hours, employee discounts and end of year bonus!
cons: You get attached to the residents and it’s sad when they get older and you learn of their passing.

pros:
I enjoy the freedom of creativity in working for a Non-Profit organization.
I love the residents!  They are so interesting and fun to get to know.
My job is challenging and rewarding.
cons: In the healthcare industry, it is difficult to cultivate relationships with residents at the end of their lives.  There are great transitions and loss which take getting used to.

pros: Supportive Coworkers, Employee Recognition Programs, Generous Paid Time Off, Great Staffing Ratio's in Nursing Department, Nice group of residents, families and volunteers
cons: Healthcare can be difficult at times, but rewards of providing compassionate care at the end of life outweigh it

pros: The residents are awesome and have great stories.
cons: Senior management is a joke.  All they do is pat each other on the back while the place is falling apart at the seams.  Senior management has neglected day to day operations and is currently in a tail spin trying to fix lack of leadership.  Major reorganization is needed to recover from years of neglect.
